div.sent: You must have already learned how many books there are in the Old Testament.
The first five books are called Pentateuch.
The sixth book has been named JOSHUA.
This book begins with the story of the conquest of Canaan by the Israelites under the leadership of Joshua.
Canaan is the land which God had promised to the descendants of Abraham, known as a land filled with milk and honey.
In this chapter you will learn about the call of Joshua and his obedience.
You will learn how he led the Israelite's in the ways of God inspite of all sorts of problems and difficulties.
You will see how much benefit they derived from Joshua's faith in and obedience to God.
At the same time you will also learn a lesson from the sad consequences the Israelites had to suffer as a result of their disobedience.
You will then realize what blessings we receive when we remain firm in our faith and obey God.
We show our obedience to God's will by living in accordance with the vocation each one of us has received.
Last year in your previous class you learned something about the story of Moses.
In obedience to God's call and by his power he freed the Israelites from their bondage in Egypt.
Strengthened by God's mercy and blessings Moses led them out as far as Moab.
This journey through the desert took long forty years.
Yet they could not reach the land promised by God.
Moses who had grown old by now, was shown this land by God from a distance, from Mount Nabo.
Who will be the leader of the Israelites when Moses dies ?
God had decided this beforehand.
The Book of Numbers says that God, through Moses, had appointed Joshua as the leader to follow him.
Do you know who this Joshua was ?
He was a son of Nun from Ephraim and one of the faithful followers of Moses.
The name `Joshua means God is salvation.
Moses changed his name from Hoshea to Joshua.
After the death of Moses, God appeared to Joshua in a vision.
He said to him: My servant Moses has died.
Now you are to lead the Israelites.
You will bring them to the land beyond the Jordan which I promised to give them.
Just like Moses, Joshua was hesitant at first.
How can an ordinary man like him fulfill such a big responsibility ?
But the Lord gave him courage.
He told him that he would be with him just as he was with Moses.
No one will dare to oppose Joshua.
He will conquer the land of Canaan.
God assured Moses of his help and gave him hope; but he also warned him about one thing.
He told him that just like Moses he should remain obedient to God and live according to his commandments.
In obedience to the Covenant the Israelites will have to observe God's commandments and everything he had spoken.
They will have to lead holy lives.
God also said to Joshua : Have courage, do not fear; for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.
Joshua assumed the responsibility of leading the Israelites just as God commanded him to do.
The people were obedient to him as they were to Moses.
Seeing his spirit of obedience to God they welcomed his leadership as the chosen people of God.
This is how Joshua received his call from God and in obedience to him took on the great responsibility to lead the Israelites.
Perhaps this story of Moses is new to you.
Try to remember that he was an ordinary man like us` He worked under Moses as a servant.
His devotion to duties and his obedience to God prepared him for fulfilling greater his work because he or she is worthy.
On the contrary, he looks for people who are obedient and faithful.
When someone is obedient to God and trusts in him, God makes him worthy to do his work.
We also have many things to do everyday.
Now you are in class VIII and so you are able to understand many things and you are capable of doing many things.
Besides studies, during your free time you have some small tasks to do.
You have to help your parents.
From now on you will have to be faithful in everything you have to do.
You have to be obedient to your parents, teachers and elders and do your duties according to their directions.
He who is faithful in little things since his childhood is chosen by God to do great things.
Jesus said, Whoever is faithful in small matters will be faithful in large ones.
It may be that sometimes you do not like to hear what your parents or the elders tell you.
What they say, may not be to your liking.
If you are obedient to them and listen to their advice, you will certainly prosper in life:
God showers his abundant blessings on those who are obedient to their parents.
Let me tell you a story.
John was the only son of his mother who was a widow.
She used to work as a cook in a Christian institution.
With her little income she managed her family and took care of John's studies.
She had a great hope and a great dream that someday John would grow up to be a real man and her sufferings would disappear.
So she tried to bring him up by giving him good advice and insisting that he pay attention to his studies.
John was very obedient to his mother, quite unlike the other children of our times.
Out of concern for his mother he used to help her in her household works.
He used to avoid enjoing unnecessery wordly offairs and infiuences of his bad friends.
Do you know what the outcome of all this was?
John passed his S.S.C. Examination very successfully.
All the teachers and the students in the school conveyed their congratulations to him.
From his mother's office came an offer of scholarship for higher studies.
In this way, his obedience to his mother responsibilities.
God never calls someone to do opened up the door of a glorious career for John.
You can imagine what blessings God will shower on someone who is obedient to him.
Joshua followed God's will in everything.
He was firm in his obedience to God.
Therefore, God made him a great leader of the Israelites from being an ordinary man.
If you are obedient to God and the respected elders, and do your duties faithfully, you are sure to find success in life.
God will shower his abundant blessings on you.
He sent some spies in advance to look over Jericho.
A woman named Rahab helped them in this matter.
Joshua understood the plan of God, for he was going to give this land into their hands.
He spent three nights there and planned how they were going to cross the river.
The leaders who were Joshua's helpers went through the camp and gave them directions.
The priests would carry the Coven-ant Box of the Lord and go before them.
All the others would follow them.
They were to maintain a distance from the priests and stay about 100 yds behind them.
This way there would be no danger of getting lost.
Then Joshua asked the people to purify themselves, so that God could work miracles before them.
Following the instructions of Joshua, the priests then set out with the Ark of the Covenant.
Then calling all the people together near him, Joshua told them what God had to say to them.
The God of the living was with them.
He would drive out the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Hivites, the Perizzites, and all the other tribes.
The Israelites would be victorious over them.
Then God did a wonderful thing for them.
As soon as the priests carrying the Covenant Box stepped into the river, the water stopped flowing.
The people walked across on dry ground and reached Jericho.
The priests carrying the Lord's Covenant Box stood on dry ground in the middle of the Jordan until all the people had crossed over.
They did so and kept the stones with them.
Finally when the priests carrying the Covenant Box reached the river bank, the river began flowing once more and flooded its banks again.
By God's grace, all the people of Israel crossed the Jordan.
In this way God made Joshua honourable to the people, just as he had said he would.
They feared Joshua and honoured him as a man of God, just as they bad feared Moses.
The crossing of the Jordan by the Israelites under the leadership of Joshua teaches us about God's power and grace.
God extended his mighty arms to help them because they were humble and obedient to him.
Inspired by Joshua's leadership, the Israelites always remained faithful and obedient to God.
They lived according to God's commandments and they praised and glorified him.
Do you know what a covenant Box was?
It was a sign or symbol of God's presence.
It was a wooden box that could be carried from one place to another.
It was three feet and nine inches long and two feet and three inches wide.
It was plaited with gold.
The top of it was like a plate of gold.
On it there were two statues of angels facing each other.
The Israelites used to carry it with them as a sign of God's invisible presence and honoured it as a source of their strength.
Therefore, they used to believe that God was with them and he was leading them through Joshua.
God is with his children who are obedient and faithful to him, and in this way he uses his power for their good.
Now listen to a story of our time.
In the nineteenth century, a woman called Amy Carmichael who was a missionary, came to India.
She had a special affection for the children and she served them with much love.
Amy dedicated everything out of love for God.
She wished that her companions would do the same.
For this reason, others often found it difficult to work with her.
Even some men were not able to work like her.
God used her for his work.
For Amy wanted to remain obedient to God and please him more than anything else.
The Carmichael College in Rangpur was named after her.
Now listen to a story from the life of Jesus.
One day the mother and the brothers of Jesus came to see him.
There was a large crowd around him.
He was told that his mother and brothers were waiting to see him.
Do you what Jesus said ?
He said, Those who hear the word of God and keep it, are my mother and my brothers.
We have to have faith in God and we have to obey Him and live according to His word.
Faith is nothing abstract; true faith is doing God's will by fulfilling our duties.
The great poet, Rabindranath Tagore, composed a beautiful song through which one can offer himself to God.
Come, let us offer ourselves to him by singing that song or by reciting it as a prayer.
Merciful Lord, let your will be done.
Mindful of your love I surrender at your feet in hope.
If there be sorrow or suffering , I'll endure everything.
I pretend not to know that your loving eyes are always watching, Your benevolent form I forget, I drown in the ocean of sorrow.
The Universe is filled with joy, beauty filled with happiness, I suffer on account of wrong pursuits.
Save me from my illusions by striking a hard blow, Day and night you stay in my heart washed with tears.
The humane nature does not remain the same for long.
He cannot steadfast in the face of trails and temptations.
God had showered wonderful blessings on Israel.
But when they disobeyed, misfortune came upon them.
The Midianites were stronger than Israel, and the people of Israel hid from them in caves and other safe places in the hills.
Whenever the Israelites sowed any seed, the Midianites would come with the Amalekites and the desert tribes and attack them.
They would camp on the land and destroy the crops as far south as the area round Gaza.
They would take all the sheep, cattle, donkeys, and leave nothing for the Israelites to live on.
They would come with their cattle and tents, as thick as locusts.
They and their camels were too many to count.
They came and devasted the land, and Israel was helpless against them.
The Israelites had taken possession of the land of Canaan by conquering one tribe after another.
They were free from all oppression: But gradually they forgot the God who loved them.
Man has strong attraction to this world.
When temptations come, he easily forgets God.
He gets carried away by illusions and pleasure of this world.
In this way he falls into darkness.
Living side by side with other nations, the same thing happened to the Israelites.
Like the other nations, they also began to worship different gods and goddesses thinking that they would protect them.
So they feared them and worshipped them.
What were the consequences ?
The Lord God was displeased with them.
All along he had loved them so much, and so their downfall made him sad.
This means that since God was displeased with the Israelites, He stopped helping them.
An Arabian tribe known as the Midianites began to persecute and oppress them.
The Israelites were unable to protect themselves from their cruelty.
Hence they went into hiding, yet they could not escape from their oppression.
This happened to the Israelites because of their infidelity.
This was the consequence of being disobedient to God.
This was the consequence of their sins.
So you can see, how sad and shocking can be the consequences of disobedience to God.
Every day, at every moment, we experience God's infinite mercy and kindness.
He provides for all our needs.
He nourishes us and he protects us.
After all these, if we disobey and forget him, then we too will face such consequences.
Similarly, when we disobey our parents, teachers and the elders, the same misfortune will befall us.
There was a news in the paper the other day.
A certain father tried to bring up his son with all the love and affection possible.
But the son gradually began to disobey his father and do mischief.
Finally the father saw no other way to control his son than handing him over to the police.
Do you think such a thing can happen?
Parents have unbounded love for their children.
But because of disobedience a father had to hand over his son to the police!
Like our parents, God also loves us.
They want our good.
But when we fail to obey them, we invite troubles for ourselves.
The most joyful experience of our life is to remain in God's love.
His love knows no bounds.
Therefore, we should never be disobedient or unfaithful to God.
It is possible for us to remain in God's love if we read the Word of God (the Bible) and pray to him regularly.
An example of such a prayer is given here : Holy God, look upon us with kindness, give us strength is our weakness.
Teach us that holy fear, so that I may fear only you and remain obedient to you.
Save us from temptations, help us to remain obedient and faithful to you all throughout our lives.
We ask you this through Jesus your son our Lord who is ever obedient to you.
God is loving and merciful.
Even though he is offended by his children, he cannot remain indifferent to them.
For out of love he has created them and hence he feels no peace until they return to him.
When men repent for their misdeeds, he shows them his infinite mercy.
In the previous lesson we saw how the Israelites were being oppressed by other nations on account of their sins.
They were not at peace, they were miserable.
Finally they came to realise their offences.
Once again they wanted to come back to God.
I rescued you from the Egyptians and from the people who fought against you here in this land.
I drove them out as you advanced, and I gave you their land.
But you did not listen to me.
Then the Israelites realized their sinful conditions.
They repented and asked for forgiveness from the Lord their God.
And what did God do ?
When he heard their cries of repentance, he sent them an angel from heaven.
The angel of the Lord came to Gideon at Ophrah with God's message.
Gideon was the son of Joash and he was threshing some wheat in a winepress.
It was summer time, and the wheat was just about ready to be harvested.
Gideon thought he would make bread out of the wheat he was threshing.
But Gideon was afraid just like everyone else.
For the enemy could come any time and rob him of the fruits of his labour.
The Israelites had been suffering like this for long seven years.
Gideon was almost at the point of despairing.
Tired and anxious, he said to himself, who will save us from the hands of our enemies ?
Will God look upon us once again with kindness ?
While thinking all these Gideon finished threshing the wheat and rested underneath a tree.
Then he hid the sack filled with wheat in a cave and went back to work.
An angel of the Lord appeared to him and said, The Lord is with you, brave and mighty man!
Gideon said to him, If I may ask sir, why has all this happened to us if the Lord is with us ?
In distress he uttered many such words.
The angel of the Lord gave him courage by saying that he was chosen by God.
He said to him, Go with all your great strength and rescue Israel from the Midianites.
But Gideon was afraid.
For his clan was the weakest in the tribe of Manasseh.
And he was the youngest son of his father.
He could not see how he could rescue the Israelites.
The Lord answered, You can do it because I will help you.
You will crush the Midianites as easily as if they were only one man.
Gideon then was given signs that God had spoken to him and that he was with him.
He truly believed that God was with him.
His faith and trust in God strengthened him.
Later on when .the
Midianites attacked the Israelites, Gideon faced them with only a few men and defeated them in a battle.
This is how the Israelites repented for their sins and received God's great favour once again.
From this story we learn that God is loving and merciful.
He is displeased when we are disobedient, and a distance is created between God and us.
But when we repent for our disobedience and sins, he forgives us and once again shows us his favour.
Now listen to another story.
Ajoy was a student and he lived in hostel.
Once upon a time, he along with some of his friends, stole some notes that Barun had prepared for his examinations and destroyed them.
Barun was a good boy and a very good student.
Could you guess what happened to Ajoy ?
He got caught by the teachers.
He was punished and along with a few others thrown out of the hostel.
So they could not appear in the examinations.
But Barun did quite well in the examinations even though his notes had been destroyed.
He felt sympathy for Ajoy and his other friends, for they could not even appear in the examinations.
In the beginning of the following year, as soon as the hostel re-opened, Ajoy came to Barun and apologised to him saying, Please forgive me.
It is not possible for me to stay at home and go to school.
Barun took Ajoy to the headmaster and pleased with him saying, Sir, please forgive them and allow them to come back to school.
The headmaster was pleased to see how generous Barun was.
He was also pleased to see Ajoy repent for his fault and so he excused him.
He advised him not to do such a thing again and allowed him to come back to the hostel.
This made everyone happy.
Disobedience and injustice destroy our relationship with God and with one another.
But when we repent and ask for forgiveness our relationship is restored and experience great joy.
Tell the Lord with your whole heart, God, I love you above all things.
Lord, I want that you will be done in me.
Dear God, please do with me what you will, I am your obedient servant.
